name: Chegg APIs - HackingEDU2015
description:
Fetch detailed information such as title, author and edition about textbooks or related items. 
Find related items to a textbook that include recommended books, supplement materials, ebooks and textbook solutions.

requests.name: Scholarships: Search scholarships by criteria
requests.description:
### Find scholarships matching specific criteria
It is PUT search by criteria scholarship request where the body would specify the scholarships filters.

#### Parameters
Request body should be `JSON` formatted. `Content-Type` HTTP header should be `application/json`.
All fields are optional but at least one should be present. Possible values are:

* `gpa` field - min gpa value
* `startNum` - start index of search results
* `age` - min age value
* `essayRequired` - is essay required to get scholorship?
* `onlineApplication` - is application online or offline?
* `meritAidOnly` - is the aid given only based on merit?
* `provider_type` - can be `REGULAR` or `SCHOOL`
* `sortBy` - can be `matchStrength` or `application_deadline`
* `schoolId` - only constraint to scholorships accepted/offered by a specific school
* `limit` - max number of records to returns, cannot be more than 10
* `startNum` - in case of pagination, result number to start from

#### Sample Usage
Body request:
```
{
    "age":"18",
    "gpa": 4,
    "limit": 10,
    "startNum": 1,
    "essayRequired": "0",
    "onlineApplication":"1",
    "meritAidOnly":"1",
    "provider_type": "REGULAR",
    "sortBy": "matchStrength",
    "schoolId":"ba8e7a1f-0042-45eb-ada0-7e0f38b81628"
}
```

requests.name: Textbook Catalog: Get item by Item ID
requests.description:
### Get item by its Item ID. Gives detailed information about the item. You can obtain the item ID from Search API response. Main interesting attributes of the books are: * type - type of the item, in most cases either *TEXTBOOK* or *EBOOK* * title - title of the item * isbn - ISBN, standard book identifier, 10 characters * ean - EAN or ISBN123, standard book identifier, 13 digits * edition - book edition text * editionNo - book edition number * primaryAuthor - primary book author * authors - the list of all book authors * description - description for the book, can be plain text or html * listPrice - list price of the book * img... attributes, url to the book cover images, there are several size options * prices section - sample list of available prices and options available for the customer to get the book, which are either *Rent* or *Sell* and come in *priceType* price attribute. Useful price attributes: * price - price of the option * pricingType.nameValuePairs.priceType - *Rent* or *Sell* * pricingType.nameValuePairs.termDays - number of days for the rental, applicable to rental only * pricingType.nameValuePairs.dueDate - due date when the book should be returned back, correlates to the termDays * logId - ID for the price that can be passed to chegg.com to place item in the cart, see Textbook Catalog: cart redirect Note that there might be multiple rental options combined with the sell options for different conditions. #### Parameters * `catalogItemId` (required, last section of the URL): item ID to get the details for. You can obtain the item ID from `Search: Basic Textbook Search` API response. #### Sample Usage `https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/catalog/priced/byId/LBP-1` #### Response example ``` { "type": "TEXTBOOK", "catalogItemId": "LBP-1", "name": "Biology", "transType": "RENTAL, SELL", "status": "ACTIVE", "catalogItemType": "TEXTBOOK", "catalogProviderId": "LBP", "createdDate": "2009-02-04 00:00:00.000 -0800", "modifiedDate": "2011-02-02 00:00:00.000 -0800", "prices": [ { "price": 79.49, "pricingType": { "nameValuePairs": { "termName": "Semester Rental", "termDays": "58", "priceType": "Rent", "expires": "2015-10-22 12:21", "term": "SEMESTER", "dueDate": "2015-12-18" } }, "logId": "ce8520a0-6508-4388-a919-30f7b22853d7" }, { "price": 24.49, "pricingType": { "nameValuePairs": { "expires": "2015-10-22 12:21", "condition": "Used", "priceType": "Sell", } }, "logId": "b6ce3c12-438b-4a2a-8b53-9af4f52441ba" } ], "isbn": "080537146X", "ean": "9780805371468", "edition": "ILL,REV", "editionNo": "7", "primaryAuthor": "Campbell, Neil A.", "bisacCode": "SCI008000", "bisacLabel": "SCIENCE Life Sciences Biology", "copyright": "2005", "illustrated": false, "listPrice": "179.40", "title": "Biology", "subtitle": null, "publisherName": "Benjamin-Cummings Publishing Company", "audienceCode": "C", "lcp": 4, "description": "

Neil Campbell and Jane Reece'sBIOLOGYremains unsurpassed as the most successful majors biology textbook in the world. This text has invited more than 4 million students into the study of this dynamic and essential discipline.The authors have restructured each chapter around a conceptual framework of five or six big ideas. An Overview draws students in and sets the stage for the rest of the chapter, each numbered Concept Head announces the beginning of a new concept, and Concept Check questions at the end of each chapter encourage students to assess their mastery of a given concept. New Inquiry Figures focus students on the experimental process, and new Research Method Figures illustrate important techniques in biology. Each chapter ends with a Scientific Inquiry Question that asks students to apply scientific investigation skills to the content of the chapter.

", "toc": null, "biblioId": 1, "containsExtra": true, "authors": [ "Campbell, Neil A.", "Reece, Jane B.", "Urry, Lisa A.", "Heyden, Robin", "Molles, Manuel" ], "width": 23.5, "length": 28.58, "height": 5.08, "weight": 7.2, "carton_qty": 3, "binding_1": "WW", "binding_2": "", "media_1": "S", "subCategory": 1, "dac": false, "publishDate": "2004-12-13", "imgWidth80": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width80.jpg", "imgWidth100": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width100.jpg", "imgWidth400": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width400.jpg", "imgWidth144": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width144.jpg", "imgBox60_70": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Box60x70.jpg", "imgWidth288": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width288.jpg", "imgWidth200": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width200.jpg", "imgWidth120": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width120.jpg" } ``` #### Notes Having `logId` of the particular price allows to redirect to chegg.com and have the item with the pricing option corresponding to the log ID placed to a cart. See `Textbook Catalog: Add textbook items to cart` API.

requests.name: Schools: Search majors by name
requests.description:
### List available majors that match search criteria 
#### Params:
  * `q` (required): search string, * is a supported wildcard
  * `fields` (optional): comma seperated list of the attributes of the Major to return; to find available attribute names, hit the endpoint without fields parameter first.
  * `limit` (optional): how many results per page to return

#### Sample Usage
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/majors/?q=name:*Computer*&limit=12`
 - All majors with string `Computer` in their names, limit result to 12 entries, get all attributes.

requests.name: Textbook Catalog: Add textbook items to shopping cart
requests.description:
### Show chegg.com site with the items added to a shopping cart. 
Add textbook item(s) to Chegg Cart.

#### Parameters
   * `command` (required): command has value of items of this format `catalogItemId,logId,quantity` separated by pipe(|).

#### Notes
This is not an API. Once catalogItemId and logID are known for a textbook item(s), load chegg site with url [http://www.chegg.com/shoppingcart/add?command=<value>](http://www.chegg.com/shoppingcart/add?command=<value>).

#### Sample Usage
 * Add single item in cart: [http://www.chegg.com/shoppingcart/add?command=LBP-41902660,49c127be-ff83-4545-85f8-604a4f69e037,1](http://www.chegg.com/shoppingcart/add?command=LBP-41902660,49c127be-ff83-4545-85f8-604a4f69e037,1)
 * Add multiple Items in cart: [http://www.chegg.com/shoppingcart/add?command=LBP-41902660,49c127be-ff83-4545-85f8-604a4f69e037,1|LBP-43898306,9b34f6b7-65e2-483f-884e-7f3219d2cdd6,1](http://www.chegg.com/shoppingcart/add?command=LBP-41902660,49c127be-ff83-4545-85f8-604a4f69e037,1|LBP-43898306,9b34f6b7-65e2-483f-884e-7f3219d2cdd6,1)

Note that those sample URLs probably won't work as is, as the prices expire. The urls here give an example of the usage.

#### Response example
User will be redirected to Chegg shopping cart page with item(s) added.

requests.name: Schools: Get major info by major ID
requests.description:
### Get detailed information of the major by its ID.

#### Params:
  * `majorID` (required): ID of the major, which you can obtain by searching majors by name, see `Schools: Search majors by name` API

#### Sample Usage
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/majors/095b2352-7476-48f8-b2d6-288088388a57` - Returns details about the major with the specified ID

requests.name: Scholarships: Get scholarships by a school
requests.description:
### Find scholarships offered by a school
A simple GET request to fetch scholorships by school ID (not IPED ID), which you can obtain from school search API (`Schools: Search schools by name` or `Schools: Get school info by ID`).

#### Parameters
  * `schoolID` (required, last section of the URL)

#### Sample Usage
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/scholarship/school/3a3172e4-17f0-42f8-907e-0af5901cd5f4`

requests.name: Scholarships: Search scholarship by name
requests.description:
### Find available scholarships by name  

#### Parameters
  * `q` (required): search string

#### Sample Usage
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/scholarshipsearch/suggest/?q=Richardson` - All scholarships with the string `Richardson` in their names

requests.name: Schools: Get school info by ID
requests.description:
### Get single school details
Get detailed school information by school ID, which you can obtain by searching for school by school name or location - see `Schools: Search schools by name`.

####Params:
  * `schoolID` (required, last section of the URL); note that schoolID is not the same as school IPED ID.

Here are the useful school fields that are exposed:

* schoolLinks
* schoolName
* schoolLocations
* alias
* schoolDeadlines
* clubSportsMen
* extraCurricularActivities
* clubSportsWomen
* sportsOffered
* highestDegreeOffered
* majors
* areasOfStudy
* schoolType
* modifiedDate
* similarSchools
* schoolTransferInformation
* schoolApplicationRequirements
* description
* schoolMediaAssets
* logoURL
* coverImageUrl
* profilePictureURL
* schoolStatistics
* admissionStatistics
* studentExperience
* costStatistics
* academicStatistics
* outcomesStatistics
* rankingStatistics
* schoolID
* schoolBasic
* region
* mascot
* ipedId
* genderPreference
* percentStudentsOutofState
* offersRollingAdmission
* fundingType
* learningEnvironment
* offersOpenAdmission
* religiousAffiliation
* schoolAbbreviation
* schoolTerm
* schoolColors
* shortName
* calendaringSystem
* schoolLocale


For each school location we expose:

* addressState
* phone
* locationId
* isPrimaryAddress
* addressLongitude
* isDeleted
* addressLine2
* modifiedDate
* addressLine1
* province-region
* city
* mailingCity
* mailingZip
* postalCode
* addressLatitude
* mailingState
* schoolID
* mailingLine2
* addressCountry
* zipMetroCode
* createdDate
* mailingLine1
*addressZip

For each major, we expose

* cipcode
* majorName
* majorId

#### Sample Usage
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/schools/ba8e7a1f-0042-45eb-ada0-7e0f38b81628`

requests.name: Textbook Catalog: Get item by EAN
requests.description:
### Get items by EAN. Gives detailed information about items by EAN (a standard book identifier). The result is an array of items that are identified by the given EAN. In most case it's expected that it would be a single book. Main interesting attributes of the books are: * type - type of the item, in most cases either `TEXTBOOK` or `EBOOK` * title - title of the item * isbn - ISBN, standard book identifier, 10 characters * ean - EAN or ISBN123, standard book identifier, 13 digits * edition - book edition text * editionNo - book edition number * primaryAuthor - primary book author * authors - the list of all book authors * description - description for the book, can be plain text or html * listPrice - list price of the book * img... attributes, url to the book cover images, there are several size options * prices section - sample list of available prices and options available for the customer to get the book, which are either *Rent* or *Sell* and come in *priceType* price attribute. Useful price attributes: * price - price of the option * pricingType.nameValuePairs.priceType - `Rent` or `Sell` * pricingType.nameValuePairs.termDays - number of days for the rental, applicable to rental only * pricingType.nameValuePairs.dueDate - due date when the book should be returned back, correlates to the termDays * logId - ID for the price that can be passed to chegg.com to place item in the cart, see Textbook Catalog: cart redirect Note that there might be multiple rental options combined with the sell options for different conditions. #### Parameters * `EAN` (required, last section of the URL): EAN of the item (which does not have to be a book) to get the details for. #### Sample Usage `https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/catalog/priced/byEan/9780805371468` #### Response example ``` [{ "type": "TEXTBOOK", "catalogItemId": "LBP-1", "name": "Biology", "transType": "RENTAL, SELL", "status": "ACTIVE", "catalogItemType": "TEXTBOOK", "catalogProviderId": "LBP", "createdDate": "2009-02-04 00:00:00.000 -0800", "modifiedDate": "2011-02-02 00:00:00.000 -0800", "prices": [ { "price": 79.49, "pricingType": { "nameValuePairs": { "termName": "Semester Rental", "termDays": "58", "priceType": "Rent", "expires": "2015-10-22 12:21", "term": "SEMESTER", "dueDate": "2015-12-18" } }, "logId": "ce8520a0-6508-4388-a919-30f7b22853d7" }, { "price": 24.49, "pricingType": { "nameValuePairs": { "expires": "2015-10-22 12:21", "condition": "Used", "priceType": "Sell", } }, "logId": "b6ce3c12-438b-4a2a-8b53-9af4f52441ba" } ], "isbn": "080537146X", "ean": "9780805371468", "edition": "ILL,REV", "editionNo": "7", "primaryAuthor": "Campbell, Neil A.", "bisacCode": "SCI008000", "bisacLabel": "SCIENCE Life Sciences Biology", "copyright": "2005", "illustrated": false, "listPrice": "179.40", "title": "Biology", "subtitle": null, "publisherName": "Benjamin-Cummings Publishing Company", "audienceCode": "C", "lcp": 4, "description": "

Neil Campbell and Jane Reece'sBIOLOGYremains unsurpassed as the most successful majors biology textbook in the world. This text has invited more than 4 million students into the study of this dynamic and essential discipline.The authors have restructured each chapter around a conceptual framework of five or six big ideas. An Overview draws students in and sets the stage for the rest of the chapter, each numbered Concept Head announces the beginning of a new concept, and Concept Check questions at the end of each chapter encourage students to assess their mastery of a given concept. New Inquiry Figures focus students on the experimental process, and new Research Method Figures illustrate important techniques in biology. Each chapter ends with a Scientific Inquiry Question that asks students to apply scientific investigation skills to the content of the chapter.

", "toc": null, "biblioId": 1, "containsExtra": true, "authors": [ "Campbell, Neil A.", "Reece, Jane B.", "Urry, Lisa A.", "Heyden, Robin", "Molles, Manuel" ], "width": 23.5, "length": 28.58, "height": 5.08, "weight": 7.2, "carton_qty": 3, "binding_1": "WW", "binding_2": "", "media_1": "S", "subCategory": 1, "dac": false, "publishDate": "2004-12-13", "imgWidth80": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width80.jpg", "imgWidth100": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width100.jpg", "imgWidth400": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width400.jpg", "imgWidth144": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width144.jpg", "imgBox60_70": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Box60x70.jpg", "imgWidth288": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width288.jpg", "imgWidth200": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width200.jpg", "imgWidth120": "http://cs.cheggcdn.com/covers2/0/1_1263591603_Width120.jpg" }] ``` #### Notes Having `logId` of the particular price allows to redirect to chegg.com and have the item with the pricing option corresponding to the log ID placed to a shopping cart. See `Textbook Catalog: Add textbook items to cart` API

requests.name: Schools: Search schools by name
requests.description:
### Get details on schools by name or location or iped ID

#### Parameters
   * `q` (required): search string, some of the supported formats of the string are:
      * `name:<school name to search, * is a whildcard>` to search by name
      * `schoolLocationName:<location name to search, * is a whildcard>` to search by alias
      * `ipedId:<iped ID>` to search by school IPED ID
   * `f.schoolType` (optional): school(s) type to search, valid values are `post-secondary` and `high-school`.
   * `fields` (optional): comma seperated list of the school attributes to be returned. Run the query without this param to see all the possible school attributes. You can also refer to `Schools: Get school info by school ID` API description.
   * `limit` (optional): how many results per page to return   

#### Sample Usage
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/schools/?q=name:*ford*&fields=schoolId,schoolName,schoolBasic.ipedId` - All schools with string `ford` in their names. \* means wildcard. Get basic fields on the schools only.

`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/schools/?q=schoolLocationName:*California*&limit=2` - Get all data on first 2 schools in California

`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/schools/?q=ipedId:110662` - School with ipedId 110662 details.

requests.name: Search: Textbooks
requests.description:
### Search textbooks by title, author, ISBN, EAN

#### Parameters
   * `q` (required): search string, results would have that string in one or more main book attributes: title, author, EAN or ISBN
   * `f.page-number`  (optional, default 1): starting page number to get the results (min value is 1)

#### Sample Usages
##### Search by title
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/search?q=algorithms`

##### Search by ISBN (supports both ISBN-10 and ISBN-13)
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/search?q=9780321573513`

##### Search by title (2nd page)
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/search?q=algorithms&f.page-number=2`

requests.name: Scholarships: Get scholarship by ID
requests.description:
### Get detailed information about the scholarship
A simple GET request to fetch detailed scholarship information by a scholarship ID which you can obtain from `Scholarships: Search scholarship by name` API.

#### Parameters
  * `scholarshipID` (required, last section of the URL)

#### Sample Usage
`https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/scholarship/40cb12a1-e579-4faa-9794-4c21c2589711`

requests.name: Textbook Catalog: Get related items by item ID
requests.description:
### Find items related to the specified one. 
Gives related items IDs and the type of their relation. Possible meaningful relation types are:

   * SUPPLEMENT_ISBN (supplemental materials for the queried one)
   * DIGITAL_LINKAGE (ebooks related to the given one)
   * RECOMMENDED_ITEMS (recommeded to get along with the specified one)
   * OTHER_EDITIONS (other editions of the item)
   * TEXTBOOK_SOLUTIONS (solutions for the item)

#### Parameters
   * `catalogItemId` (required): item ID to find related items for

#### Notes
Having `catalogItemIdTo` for the related item as a part of the response, additonal details about it can be retrieved by passing related ID to `Textbook Catalog: get by Item ID` call.

#### Sample Usage
https://hackingedu.chegg.com/hacking-edu/catalog/relateditem/priced/getRelatedItems?catalogItemId=LBP-1

#### Response example
This is one section (element of the array) of the response
``` 
{
    "catalogItemIdFrom": "LBP-1",
    "catalogItemIdTo": "LBP-21900767",
    "createdBy": null,
    "modifiedBy": null,
    "createdDate": null,
    "modifiedDate": null,
    "catalogItemTypeFrom": "TEXTBOOK",
    "catalogItemTypeTo": "TEXTBOOK",
    "relationshipType": "OTHER_EDITIONS",
    "active": true
}
```
